title: (x) Fine Arts Connection - Shelley Andante, ITC Edwardian Script {Marcelo R}
content:
any help is much appreciated, thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161815im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/FAC%20logo_3507.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Prada.com monospaced grotesque - Akkurat Mono {Florian, Kristian M}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161815/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36749 "Go to previous forum topic") [Who knows this lead script font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161815/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36639 "Go to next forum topic")
author: stealyourboognish

comments.content: [Shelley Andante](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161815/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/shelley-script/shelley-andante-script/), except for the “C”... that is [Edwardian Script alt](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161815/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-edwardian-script/edwardian-scr-alt-itc-bold/)

Actually, its the “C” that matches Edwardian Script ITC.  
The rest doesn’t seem to match. Still looking for help.
???? The “C” is Edwardian, the rest is Shelley Andante, as I posted and linked.
